solution_line_template: The {num_linemen} linemen go first and will drink a total of {num_linemen}*{ounces_per_lineman} = <<{num_linemen}*{ounces_per_lineman}={linemen_water_consumed}>>{linemen_water_consumed} ounces of water from the cooler.
This will leave {cooler_capacity} - {linemen_water_consumed} = <<{cooler_capacity}-{linemen_water_consumed}={remaining_water}>>{remaining_water} ounces for the skill position players.

Then, the {remaining_water} ounces of water that remains is enough for {remaining_water}/{ounces_per_skill_player} = <<{remaining_water}/{ounces_per_skill_player}={skill_players_can_drink}>>{skill_players_can_drink} of the skill position players.

Therefore, {total_skill_players} - {skill_players_can_drink} = <<{total_skill_players}-{skill_players_can_drink}={skill_players_waiting}>>{skill_players_waiting} skill position players must wait for the cooler to be refilled before they can get a drink.
